required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of the Free Margin Cusp Sizer (CALIBRATE)
clinical_study.official_title: CALIBRATE TRIAL: a Prospective, Single Arm Investigational Clinical Trial Evaluating Safety and Performance of the Free Margin Cusp Sizer During Aortic Valve Repair Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

clinical_study.source: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to investigate safety and performance of the Free Margin Cusp sizer. The device will be used during aortic valve repair and sparing procedures as a caliper to measure the aortic valve free margin length at different stages of the procedure. The patient will be followed for one year clinically (at 1, 2, 6 and 12 months) and by echocardiography (at 6 and 12 months) to assess aortic valve function.

primary_outcome.description: Aortic valve damage caused by the cusp sizer (cusp tear or perforation), rate of conversion from AV repair to AV replacement due to the use of the cusp sizer
Patient Survival status at 30 days after surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Major adverse cardiac and cerebrovascular events (MACCE)
primary_outcome.description: Mortality, stroke or transient ischemic attack, major bleeding, cardiac reintervention
Aortic valve regurgitation and transvalvular gradient by transthoracic echocardiography

secondary_outcome.description: Length of the 3 leaflets free margin before aortic valve repair
Length of the 3 leaflets free margin after aortic valve repair

arm_group.description: Patients in whom the free margin cusp sizer will be used to measure the free margin of the three leaflets of the aortic valve during aortic valve repair.

intervention.description: The free margin cusp sizer will be used during aortic valve repair and sparing procedures as a caliper to measure the aortic valve free margin length.

overall_official.affiliation: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

reference.citation: De Kerchove L, Momeni M, Aphram G, Watremez C, Bollen X, Jashari R, Boodhwani M, Astarci P, Noirhomme P, El Khoury G. Free margin length and coaptation surface area in normal tricuspid aortic valve: an anatomical study. Eur J Cardiothorac Surg. 2018 May 1;53(5):1040-1048. doi: 10.1093/ejcts/ezx456.

Tamer S, Mastrobuoni S, van Dyck M, Navarra E, Bollen X, Poncelet A, Noirhomme P, Astarci P, El Khoury G, de Kerchove L. Free margin length and geometric height in aortic root dilatation and leaflet prolapse: implications for aortic valve repair surgery. Eur J Cardiothorac Surg. 2020 Jan 1;57(1):124-132. doi: 10.1093/ejcts/ezz132. Erratum in: Eur J Cardiothorac Surg. 2020 Jan 1;57(1):206.
